security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides guidance on using Claude's parallel agent capabilities. It contains no executable code, network calls, or file operations - only markdown documentation with best practices and examples.

content.user_title: Run Multiple AI Agents in Parallel
content.value_statement: Stop solving problems one at a time. This skill helps you dispatch multiple AI agents to tackle independent issues simultaneously, cutting resolution time dramatically. Perfect for when you're facing multiple test failures or unrelated bugs across different parts of your codebase.
actual_capabilities: Dispatch multiple agents in a single message for automatic parallel execution
Create focused, non-conflicting tasks for each agent with clear scope and constraints
Coordinate background and foreground task execution patterns
Generate properly scoped agent prompts that prevent cross-agent interference
Integrate results from multiple concurrent agent operations
limitations: Requires independent tasks that don't share state or modify the same files
Cannot handle interconnected failures or dependent tasks
Task IDs are only valid within the same response when using background execution
Maximum effectiveness requires clear problem domain separation

use_cases.title: Fix 3+ Independent Test Failures
use_cases.description: When your test suite has failures across auth, API, and UI components, dispatch specialized agents to fix each domain simultaneously.

use_cases.title: Parallel Infrastructure Investigation
use_cases.description: Investigate database issues, API timeouts, and deployment failures concurrently with different specialist agents.

use_cases.title: Multi-Domain Code Review
use_cases.description: Run security audits, performance analysis, and code quality checks in parallel while continuing development work.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Parallel Tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: I have failures in three areas: auth tests (src/auth/), API tests (src/api/), and UI tests (src/components/). Dispatch agents to fix each area independently.

prompt_templates.title: Background + Foreground
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a background security audit, then implement the login form. After implementation, collect the audit results and summarize.

prompt_templates.title: Complex Multi-Agent Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Design the system architecture, create the database schema, implement the API layer, and build the frontend components - all in parallel.

prompt_templates.title: Expert Parallel Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Run parallel reviews: security audit, performance analysis, maintainability check, and API contract validation for this codebase.

output_examples.input: I have 4 failing tests: 2 auth tests in src/auth/login.test.ts, 1 API test in src/api/users.test.ts, and 1 UI test in src/components/Login.test.tsx. Fix them all.
output: - Agent 1: Fixing auth tests (email validation + password requirements)
- Agent 2: Fixing API test (user endpoint validation)
- Agent 3: Fixing UI test (login form submission)
- Auth: Fixed email regex pattern and added password length validation
- API: Added missing user ID validation in endpoint
- UI: Updated form submit handler to prevent default behavior
✓ All tests now passing - total resolution time: 2.3 minutes

best_practices: Group failures by domain before dispatching agents - ensure tasks are truly independent
Include specific file paths, error messages, and constraints in each agent prompt
Use foreground parallel execution (single message) for quick tasks that need immediate results
Always verify no conflicts between agent changes before merging results
anti_patterns: Don't dispatch agents to work on the same files or interconnected systems - this creates conflicts
Avoid vague prompts like 'fix everything' - agents need specific scope and success criteria
Never use background tasks for quick operations - foreground parallel is simpler and faster

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude Code versions?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill works with any Claude Code version that supports the Task tool. No additional setup required.

faq.question: How many agents can I run in parallel?
faq.answer: There's no hard limit, but 3-5 agents is optimal. More agents may slow down response times.

faq.question: Can agents communicate with each other during execution?
faq.answer: No, agents work independently. This prevents conflicts but means they can't share intermediate results.

faq.question: What happens if one agent fails?
faq.answer: Other agents continue running. You'll get partial results and can fix the failed agent's task separately.

faq.question: How do I prevent agents from conflicting?
faq.answer: Specify clear constraints in prompts, use different file paths, and ensure tasks are truly independent.

faq.question: Should I use this for simple 2-task scenarios?
faq.answer: For just 2 tasks, sequential execution might be simpler. Use parallel agents for 3+ independent tasks.
